Sentencas: Electronic properties of orthorhombic SSM (Sm0.5Sr0.5MnO3) and monoclinic SSM (Sm0.8Sr0.2MnO3) are investigated using the first-principles calculation.
Titulo: Electronic properties of SmxSr1-xMnO3 for solid oxide fuel cell application - a first-principles study

Sentencas: The half-metallic behavior that leads to the mixed ionic and electronic conductivity (MIEC) property is identified in orthorhombic SSM.
Titulo: Electronic properties of SmxSr1-xMnO3 for solid oxide fuel cell application - a first-principles study

Sentencas: In addition, the strong covalent bonding between Mn-p and O-s orbitals of orthorhombic SSM is identified from the PDOS plot.
Titulo: Electronic properties of SmxSr1-xMnO3 for solid oxide fuel cell application - a first-principles study

Sentencas: The strong covalent bonding enhances the O-2 molecular adsorption on Mn atom.
Titulo: Electronic properties of SmxSr1-xMnO3 for solid oxide fuel cell application - a first-principles study

Sentencas: On the other hand, monoclinic SSM shows the pure conducting behavior and there is no covalent bonding between Mn and O atoms.
Titulo: Electronic properties of SmxSr1-xMnO3 for solid oxide fuel cell application - a first-principles study

Sentencas: Thus, the results suggest that the half-metal Sm0.5Sr0.5MnO3 might be a suitable cathode material for intermediate-temperature solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Electronic properties of SmxSr1-xMnO3 for solid oxide fuel cell application - a first-principles study
